<gmd:code>            <gco:CharacterString>115636</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:code>          <gmd:codeSpace>            <gco:CharacterString>http://www.ccw.gov.uk</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:codeSpace>        </gmd:RS_Identifier>      </gmd:identifier>     </gmd:CI_Citation>    </gmd:citation>    <!-- Resource Abstract -->    <gmd:abstract>     <gco:CharacterString>       Grateloupia turuturu, Devil's tongue weed is a non native species in the UK. Non natives have the ability to cause severe impacts to native flora and fauna.  A survey was undertaken to search for and record the presence of G. turuturu within Neyland marina and the surrounding Milford Haven area.  The results are published in NRW Evidence Report no.17     </gco:CharacterString>    </gmd:abstract>    <!-- Owner -->    <gmd:pointOfContact>     <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>      <gmd:organisationName> were surveyed for the species. This involved people snorkelling around the structures and recording the presence.  22 pontoons at Neyland marina including all of the 184 finger pontoons were surveyed by teams of 2 people.         </gco:CharacterString>        </gmd:statement>       </gmd:LI_Lineage>     </gmd:lineage>    </gmd:DQ_DataQuality>   </gmd:dataQualityInfo> </gmd:MD_Metadata>
